title: China's foreign minister calls for the U.S. to remove tariffs and sanctions
text: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi laid out specific requests for U.S. President Joe Biden's administration as the two countries navigate a tense relationship.

title: Asia shares edge up as bond yields, resources steal the show
text: Asian share markets inched higher on Monday as expectations for faster economic growth and inflation globally batter bonds and boost commodities, though rising real yields also make equity valuations look more stretched in comparison.

title: Weekly Commentary: Wrecking Ball
text: Fed officials this week seemed to be lined up to pacify the bond market with the view that heightened inflationary pressures were transitory and a non-issue. This should make bonds jittery. Commodities prices have been surging. And this week JPMorgan boosted their forecasts for Q2 growth to 9.5% and the 2021 expansion to 6.4%.

title: Stock futures rise slightly after S&P 500 snaps a 2-week winning streak
text: Some equity investors grew concerned about rapidly rising bond yields in recent weeks.

title: 'Explosion of economic activity' may put inflation fears in check. Here's why
text: National Securities' Art Hogan explains why he's brushing off inflation jitters.

title: U.S. IPO Weekly Recap: The IPO Market Takes Its Annual February Break In A 1 IPO Week
text: The IPO market took a break this week, with just one issuer raising $44 million. New filers continued to build the IPO pipeline, with 10 IPOs and 45 SPACs submitting initial filings.

title: 4 Scenarios About Inflation
text: Inflation is coming back, according to a Producer Price Index report published by the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics last week.

title: Dow Jones, S&P 500, and Nasdaq continue to trade near record highs. Here are the next targets
text: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq weakened last trading week while the Dow Jones advanced 0.1%. Wall Street's three main indexes continue to trade near record highs, and technically looking, there is still no sign of the correction.

title: Why It's Time To Book Profits In The Stock Market
text: The weekly charts of major indexes are starting to show technical warnings.

title: Prepare For A New Macroeconomic And Market Environment
text: This is a weekly series focused on analyzing the previous week's economic data releases. The objective is to concentrate on leading indicators of economic activity to determine whether the economy is strengthening or weakening, and the rate of inflation is increasing or decreasing.

title: With 2020 Hindsight, Where Does Housing Go From Here?
text: Inventory of available homes plummeted throughout the latter half of 2020 and is now the lowest it has ever been in history in many areas. The extreme shortage makes the few available homes rare and almost priceless in the minds of hungry buyers.

title: Week In Review: Yuanxin Raises $465 Million For Online Healthcare Company Miaoshou Doctor
text: Beijing Yuanxin Technology raised $465 million in a Series E round to support its online/offline healthcare operations. Shanghai Microport Cardioflow Medtech, a spinout from China medical device maker Microport, completed a $324 million IPO in Hong Kong.

title: Most Overweight Global Equities Since …
text: The opening and closing action last week in the S&P 500 got the attention of technical analyst Tom Aspray, from the Viper Report. It may be especially relevant with the current high allocation to global equities.

title: The 'Roaring Kitty' Stock Market (And Sentiment Results)
text: It the market euphoric, cautious or both? What sectors are setting up for a short-term bounce?

title: Xiaomi Follows Baidu Into EV-Making, Sparks Fly
text: Although Chinese markets were closed for the LNY break, global investors reacted excitedly to news coming out of China with equities trading in international exchanges. The disrupted Chinese New Year plans for the migrant workers resulted in new trends benefiting several sectors, including the e-commerce platforms.

title: Ride The Bull Market With Convertibles: Yield, Low Volatility And Upside
text: Convertible Securities (bonds and preferred stocks) provide investors with high yield combined with the potential for price appreciation. They are much less volatile than equities and reduce downside risk because of their seniority in the capital structure.

title: The Dividend Aristocrats Ranked By Quality Scores
text: This article ranks the 65 Dividend Aristocrats using DVK Quality Snapshots. There are three newcomers, while three spin-offs were removed because their combined dividends as three separate entities decreased.

title: Buy stocks and sell bonds as a new secular bull market delivers double digit returns, Ned Davis Research says
text: Investors should reduce their allocation to bonds and use those proceeds to buy stocks, Ned Davis Research said in a note on Thursday. The research firm said a bullish uptick in the global breadth of earnings growth favors stocks more than bonds, and technical momentum indicators are also exhibiting signs of strength for equities.

title: Sentiment Speaks: Congress May Increase The Moral Hazard Building In The Market
text: The moral hazard represented by our stock market is increasing. The higher the market goes, the more this moral hazard will increase.

title: An Update Of The Output Gap
text: In August 2020, the Congressional Budget Office projected a wide 6.6 percentage point gulf between actual and potential GDP in 2020. The CBO also in August 2020, projected that the output gap would persist for the entire decade.

title: The Markets May Be Starting To Worry About Rates
text: While the money flow itself remains strongly positive, the “sell signals” continue to suggest downward pressure on prices currently. Given the more extreme overbought and bullish conditions, there is a risk of a deeper correction over the next few weeks.

title: SPAC Week II: Cannabis SPACs (Podcast Transcript)
text: SPAC Week II: Cannabis SPACs (Podcast Transcript)
